Title: Cortical Projections of Area V2 in the Macaque
Abstract: To determine the locus, extent and topograhic organization of cortical projections of area V2, we injected tritiated amino acids under electrophysiological control into 15 V2 sites in 14 macaques. The injection sites included the foveal representation and representations ranging from central to far peripheral eccentricities in both the upper and lower visual fields. The results indicated that all V2 sites project topographically back to V1 and forward to V3, V4 and MT. There is also a topographically organized projection from V2 to V4t, but this projection is limited to the lower visual field representation. V2 thus appears to project to virtually all the visual cortex within the occipital lobe. In addition to these projections to occipital visual areas, V2 sites representing eccentricities of approximately 30 degrees and greater project to three visual areas in parietal cortex-the medial superior temporal (MST), parieto-occipital (PO) and ventral intraparietal (VIP) areas. This peripheral field representation of V2 also projects to area VTF, a visual area located in area TF on the posterior parahippocampal gyrus. Projections from the peripheral field representation of V2 of parietal areas could provide a direct route for rapid activation of circuits serving spatial vision and spatial attention.

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation: "Finally, because we were unable to identify unequivocally the borders of areas VIP, TEO and VTF, their locations were inferred from previous anatomical and physiological studies." p. 111

@Methods.Comments: In the first 13 animals unilateral injections in V2 were made. In case 4 and 14 V2 was   bilaterally injected.

@Injections.Citation: "In this case the injection was placed in the foveal representation of V2." p. 113
"As in case 9, the injection in case 10 was placed in the peripheral upper field of V2 (42°)." p. 117

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In this case, as in case 9, areas V3v, PO, MTp, VIP and VTF all contained labeled terminals (Fig. 10). In addition, as for the more central and intermediate upper field cases, case10 also showed labeled terminals in V4 and MT; in both areas the label was in their peripheral upper field representations. Finally this was the only case to show projections to TEO and area prostriata." p. 117

@Injections.Citation: "In case 11 we injected the representation of the vertical meridian in the upper field of V2 (i.e. the V1/V2 border) at 6,5° eccentricity after making a series of parasagittal penetrations in which we mapped receptive fields across areas V2, V3v, V4, TEO and VTF (Fig. 12)." p. 120
"Figure 13 shows the distribution of labeled terminals after an injection at the anterior border of V2 at an eccentricity of 2,6° in the lower visual field (case 12)." p. 122
"In case 13 we also injected the anterior border of dorsal V2, but at a mlre peripheral field representation (Fig. 14)." pp. 123-124

"In case 14 we injected the peripheral field representation of V2 at an eccentricity of 48° in the lower visual field (Fig. 14). The injected region was located on the posterior bank of the parieto-occipital sulcus and included the sulcal floor, spreading into the ventral portion of area PO." p. 125

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Like several of the other peripheral field cases, this case showed projections to the peripheral field representations of V1, V3d and MT (including MTp), as well as projections to MST, PO and VIP. This case showed additional projections to areas PIP and MIP (Colby et al.,1988), and to another zone medial to VIP which has not as yet been defined." p. 125

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 15 resembled that in case 14, except that the injected region spread into an area medial to PO rather than into PO itself." p. 125

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This case, like the peripheral field cases with injections confined to V2 (cases 7-10), showed projections back to V1 and forward to PO, MTp, MST and VTF. This case showed also projections to MIP, which may have resulted from spread of the tracer beyound the V2 border." p. 125

@Injections.Citation: "In case 2, the injection of tritiated amino acids was placed at 4,5° eccentricity in the lower field representation of V2." p. 113
@Injections.Comments: During the course of the experiment, the animal suffered an infarct and as a consequence, there was a lesion in the central lower field representation of V1. Injection involved the white matter.

@Injections.Citation: "In case 3, the injection was also placed in the lower field representation of V2, but at a somewhat more central eccentricity." p. 116

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The resulting label in V3d, V4, V4t and MT closely resembled that found in case 2, except that more central visual field representations were labeled in case 3 (see Fig. 7)." p. 116

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 7 shows the results from an injection of tritiated amino acids into the lower field representation of V2 at an eccentricity of about 15°." p. 117
"In this case, the injection was placed at 3,5° eccentricity in the upper field representation of V2, as shown in Figure 7." p. 117
"Figure 8 shows the distribution of labeled terminals following an injection of tritiated amino acids into the upper field representation of V2 at an eccentricity of 17,5°." p. 117

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The locations of the labeled terminals in V1, V3v, V4 and MT closely matched the visual field topography of the injection site. As exspected, no label was found in V4t, an area which contains only a representation of the lower visual field (Desimone and Ungerleider, 1986; Fiorani et al., 1989)." p. 117

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 9 shows the distribution of labeled terminals after an injection into the peripheral lower field of V2 at an eccentricity of 46° (case 7)." p. 117

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Like the previous cases, this case showed topographically organized projections to V3d, V4 and MT. ... Unlike the other cases, this case also showed projections to PO, MST and VIP." p. 117

@Injections.Citation: "As in case 7, the injection in case 8 was placed in the representation of the peripheral lower field of V2, but at a lesser eccentricity (30°). The injection crossed the V1/V2 border and undoubtedly also included a small portion of the peripheral lower field representation of V1." p. 117

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Like case 7, case 8 showed topographically organized projections back to V1 and forward to V3d, V4 and MT, as well as additional projections to PO and VIP. Unlike case 7, this case showed a small projection to V4t but none to MST... ." p. 117

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 11 shows the distribution of label after an injection into peripheral upper field of V2 at an eccentricity of 48° (case 9)." p. 117

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Similar to case 7, projections were found back to V1 and forward to V3v, PO, MTp, MST and VIP." p. 117
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: In addition, there was a projection to an undefined region located between V3A and LIPv.

publication.title: Cortical Projections of Area V2 in the Macaque
publication.abstract: To determine the locus, extent and topograhic organization of cortical projections of area V2, we injected tritiated amino acids under electrophysiological control into 15 V2 sites in 14 macaques.
